poem:
Title: In The Shadows of Power

When the common man weeps,
Under Northamptonshire eaves.
The wealthy ex-donor still reaps,
His political tide never leaves.

Arguing with fervour, laughter intact,
On topics of life, governance cracked.
Yet who truly navigates the pact?
Influence, in subtleties, compact.

Is it the Conservative's core,
Or the backseat voices wanting more?
In Wellingborough's political lore,
Reform whispers: less, is more.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Who’s steering the Conservatives to the right? The backseat drivers of Reform UK | John Harris Last Thursday, I spent 20 joyous minutes standing outside an office block in Northamptonshire, loudly arguing with a very wealthy former Tory donor who is standing – for another party – in next week’s Wellingborough byelection. We debated such issues as immigration, knife crime and the dire state of the NHS, before he told me what he thought of". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
